Package mealplanner

Class MealPlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • mealplanner.MealPlan
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class MealPlan
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Meal Plan is defined by a list of Days, each Day being an ArrayList of meals. A Meal Plan has a name as well as a Calorie count
    See Also:
    Day, Meal, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      The total amount of Calories in a meal plan, that being the sum of each day's total Calories, a day's calories being the sum of each meal in that day.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Day> weekPlan
      An ArrayList of Days with a initial capacity of 7.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • weekPlan

        private java.util.ArrayList<Day> weekPlan
        An ArrayList of Days with a initial capacity of 7. A week plan, in relation to a meal plan, is used as the container for the days in the meal plan, each day also being a list of meals. The capacity of a week plan should remain at 7 but isn't declared final because of the changing contents. An ArrayList is used instead of a linked list because it contains mutable objects.
        See Also:
        Day, MealPlan

      • totalCalories

        private int totalCalories
        The total amount of Calories in a meal plan, that being the sum of each day's total Calories, a day's calories being the sum of each meal in that day.
        See Also:
        Day.getTotalCalories(), Meal.getCalories()

      • planName

        private java.lang.String planName
        The user specified name of the meal plan. Examples like "low calorie" or "Chicken" or "Week 1". Defaults to "Default" when not specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MealPlan

        public MealPlan()
        No-arg constructor for MealPlan. Name of the plan is set to Default Plan. 7 Day objects are added to week plan, corresponding to the Days of the week.Total Calories are calculated using the getTotalCalories Method.

      • MealPlan

        public MealPlan​(java.lang.String planName)
        Constructor for MealPlan. Name of the plan is set to the specified name. 7 Day objects are added to week plan, corresponding to the Days of the week.Total Calories are calculated using the getTotalCalories Method.

    • Method Detail

      • getWeekPlan

        public java.util.ArrayList<Day> getWeekPlan()

      • getTotalCalories

        public int getTotalCalories()
        Calculates the amount of Calories in a plan by adding the total calories of each day in the plan.
        Returns:
        the summed total of Calories
        See Also:
        Day.getTotalCalories()

        public java.lang.String getPlanName()
